column4: i tried to follow a tutoiral on how to make your ubuntu look like a mac
and ever since then ive been getting wreird messages about video modes when i start ubuntu
i followed a turoial on how to make ubuntu look like a mac, after which i have been getting messages just after grub about how i entered an invalid number or something.... CAN ANYONE HELP!! PLEASE!!!
i followed a turoial on how to make ubuntu look like a mac, after which i have been getting messages just after grub about how i entered an invalid number or something.... CAN ANYONE HELP!! PLEASE!!!
do what martyn said and report back if it doesn't work.
I don't see any grub instructions there.
I found the bad instructions on p2 of your tutorial. Go to System > Administration > Startup-Manager and put the resolution back to something unstupid.
then follow his instructions to boot livecd and reconstruct grub. Using that screen put a bad screen resolution into your grub config.
if a reinstall isn't a giant tragedy, it might be the simplest path for you.
ubuntu will cheerfully deploy the LAMP components and also samba. It's just a matter of what you install and configure.
